events.name: EOL EVB disposal and circular economy
events.wd_label: EOL EVB disposal and circular economy
events.wd_description: Proper End-of-Life (EOL) Electric Vehicle Battery (EVB) disposal according to circular economy principles, focusing on echelon utilization before recycling, reverse logistics, and sustainable management.
events.description: Proper End-of-Life (EOL) Electric Vehicle Battery (EVB) disposal according to circular economy principles, focusing on echelon utilization before recycling, reverse logistics, and sustainable management.

events.name: Echelon utilization
events.wd_description: The process of using batteries in secondary applications before recycling raw materials.
events.description: The process of using batteries in secondary applications before recycling raw materials.

events.name: Recycling
events.wd_description: The process of recovering valuable resources from scrap batteries.
events.description: The process of recovering valuable resources from scrap batteries.

events.name: Reverse logistics
events.wd_description: The logistics involved in returning products for proper disposal and recycling.
events.description: The logistics involved in returning products for proper disposal and recycling.

events.name: Economic benefits
events.description: The driving force behind the supply chain of EOL EVB is economic benefits, emphasizing the need for a supply chain that benefits all participants.

events.name: Win win situation of economy society and environment
events.description: SSCF highlights the balance and mutual benefits among economic, social, and environmental aspects.

events.name: Neglected social and environmental dimensions
events.description: Research often overlooks social and environmental dimensions while overemphasizing immediate economic benefits.

events.name: Interdisciplinary perspective
events.description: Better understanding from an interdisciplinary perspective can improve sustainable EOL EVB management.

events.name: High costs as obstacle
events.description: High costs of electrode materials such as cobalt, lithium, and nickel are becoming an obstacle to EV adoption and large-scale energy storage system establishment.

events.name: Recycling to avoid contamination
events.description: Proper handling and recycling of different types of batteries help avoid heavy metal contamination and prevent fires or explosions.

events.name: Emphasis on EOL EVB disposal
events.description: Sustainable supply chain management must emphasize the EOL EVB disposal industry due to financial and regulatory challenges.

events.name: Economic sustainability
events.description: SCF helps realize economic sustainability by addressing cash flow problems and gradually involving environmental and social issues.

events.name: Climate change and energy crisis attention
events.description: Considerable attention to climate change and the energy crisis in the automotive industry is leading to the vigorous promotion of EVs.

events.name: Sustainable multi stakeholder centric network
events.description: The EV supply chain, covering EOL EVB disposal, requires a more sustainable multi-stakeholder-centric network rather than a firm-centric business model.

events.name: Mitigation of default risk
events.description: SSCF financial evaluation can mitigate the default risk of adopters facing government shutdowns due to unsustainable practices.
